abstract: Many business people have begun to use emoticons in their email correspondence as way to ensure that their tone is not misconstrued; others deplore these whimsical signifiers as lazy and unprofessional.
snippet: The emoticon has migrated from the e-mails and texts of teenagers to the correspondence of professionals who pride themselves on their gravitas.
lead_paragraph: The emoticon has migrated from the e-mails and texts of teenagers to the correspondence of professionals who pride themselves on their gravitas.

headline.main: If You’re Happy and You Know It, Must I Know, Too?
headline.print_headline: If You’re Happy and You Know It, Must I Know, Too?
headline.seo: Emoticons Move to the Business World - Cultural Studies
